title: Honor CEO shows upcoming Magic7 Pro
description: Honor CEO George Zhao has given us a glimpse at the upcoming Honor Magic7 Pro in a demo he recently did. The phone is housed in one of those camouflage cases, meant for prototypes only, and designed to hide most of their distinctive design features. Thus, as you can see, we can't really tell a lot from these images. What is obvious is that the phone has a pill shaped cutout at the top of the screen housing the selfie camera and 3D face unlock tech. The screen also appears to be curved, just like its predecessor's. Tiny bezels are a given in late 2024 for high-end Chinese phones, and...
excerpt: The phone will be made official on October 30. Honor CEO George Zhao has given us a glimpse at the upcoming Honor Magic7 Pro in a demo he recently did. The...
text: Honor CEO George Zhao has given us a glimpse at the upcoming Honor Magic7 Pro in a demo he recently did. The phone is housed in one of those camouflage cases, meant for prototypes only, and designed to hide most of their distinctive design features. Thus, as you can see, we can't really tell a lot from these images. What is obvious is that the phone has a pill shaped cutout at the top of the screen housing the selfie camera and 3D face unlock tech. The screen also appears to be curved, just like its predecessor's. Tiny bezels are a given in late 2024 for high-end Chinese phones, and the Magic7 Pro doesn't disappoint. On the back there's way less to look at since the case completely obscures the design of the camera island. The LED flash is visible, as are two cameras, but there's also a lot we can't see. The Honor Magic7 series will become official on October 30. Source (in Chinese) | Via
html:
Honor CEO George Zhao has given us a glimpse at the upcoming Honor Magic7 Pro in a demo he recently did. The phone is housed in one of those camouflage cases, meant for prototypes only, and designed to hide most of their distinctive design features.

Thus, as you can see, we can't really tell a lot from these images. What is obvious is that the phone has a pill shaped cutout at the top of the screen housing the selfie camera and 3D face unlock tech.

The screen also appears to be curved, just like its predecessor's. Tiny bezels are a given in late 2024 for high-end Chinese phones, and the Magic7 Pro doesn't disappoint.

On the back there's way less to look at since the case completely obscures the design of the camera island. The LED flash is visible, as are two cameras, but there's also a lot we can't see.

The Honor Magic7 series will become official on October 30.

Source (in Chinese) | Via
